description: lack of vertial tabs

Its a good replacement for Notepad++ on windows, but it has not been updated for years. Too bad.
So now I started to use VS code instead.

Settings->Preferences->General
Uncheck "Backup open documents every 15 seconds"

Bug reported already here: https://github.com/notepadqq/notepadqq/issues/1109

Since it's already been reported, hopefully it will be fixed soon. Until then, ABS (always be savin'). Get comfortable with Ctrl+s.

I prefer this over Kate because it remembers all your previous tabs without any Session nonsense. It's a very good replacement for Notepad++. I wish it could have new themes with XML format instead of CSS. Even a style configure would be nice.
It won't stay open more than a few seconds, then crashes and quits. Impossible to use. Ubuntu 24 with Cinnamon.

summary: Great transition app for windows users

description: Read all of the reviews and calculated the odds that this thing would work right versus this thing sucking, and I went ahead and installed it anyway. Not sure what I was expecting. Hung up trying to open a LUA file and crashed. Removed.

We've been using Notepad++ and Notepadpp on Windows and Linux for as long as they exist; in our dev studio it's de-facto standard for both code and text editing. It is well-thought, with very useful feature of switching syntax highlighting pattern to any given language\dialect on-the-go. Absolutely must have software and can easily replace any "included" linux text editor.
summary: A great *nix port of all-time classic Notepad++

description: im a simple note user , one of my friend recomend me to use qq.

for me it's the perfect notepad++ replacement as I switched to linux. I had notepad++ run with wine, but it didn't recognise tabs for search and replace and some other stuff wasn't quite working as I wanted it. So the native app Notepadqq does it all perfectly!! Great job, very happy I found this 
The only thing I'm really missing here is the file comparison addon I'm using this a lot to compare especially sql files but I'm sure i find something for linux for this as well.
Just like Notepad++ in Windows

+ Great Notepad++ Linux alternative.
- Bad clipboard management (highlight + middle click)

This should be beta...
summary: It freezed a completely fresh Ubuntu install on a second Paste op

Crashes all the time.
It lost my unsaved data several times (even without OS crash). It's too dangerous to keep using it so I switched to another program.
summary: I had to stop using it

description: crash all the times

First time opening the app was fine, but as soon as I opened multiple files, the file switcher bar dissapeared and I could no longer interact with anything (ubuntu 20.04.2). Consider the wine version of Notepad++ that is included in the snap store.
At First It worked. But after updating it's not

I had it working perfectly, until one time the computer turn off for battery life. and i LOST EVERYTHING! the saved files had only old modifycations. All the none saved files, were emtpy. Never again. Be carefull!
summary: Carefull you can lose not saved files

description: This is certainly a good app. I just wish it had as much functionality as Notepad++ did.

It crashes everythime.

gets the job done day-to-day but it's buggy. I tried to ctrl+tab to switch tabs and the entire program freezes- I have to restart my computer to get it working. And I miss how npp would auto-save work in progress; not having that feature is a huge difference for me
don't install this on kde!
Doesn't work at all

Ever tried to select a VERTICAL block of text? Mousepad flops totaly there. Not to mention Gedit and it's that multi-line plugin. I wasted 10 minutes trying to select a vertical block of text.

This editor might not be a perfect one, but FOR THE MOMENT, I'll stick with it. I needed like 5 seconds to get what I wanted.
No text cursor and unable to edit any opened files. Most of UI is unresponsive including tab close buttons.

at first glance, this seems to be a nice port of notepad++.
...then you notice instantly notice that it's gone stagnant compared to the constantly updating original, looking a few updates older. looking at the github, you notice it hasn't updated in *3 years*, save for a few bug fixes *a year ago*
...and how surprisingly frequently it crashes. like, *once every one or two days* sometimes.
...and that, apparently, instead of using a cache file like npp, it's silently in the background, eating ram even when not in use (and doing god knows what else according to the other reviews)

i so badly want this to be a good port, but i can just barely scrach 3/5 stars for being even remotely close to what it should be.

tl;dr- "i want to be able to use this, but the present is bleak and in afraid it doesnt have a future"

I found my cpu with high occupation based on the fun noise several times. However, I checked on the system monitor and found it was notepadqq, but I didn't start it at all. It start itself at backstage, does anyone know what it doing?

description: No idea why others vote this bad, maybe they should go back to windows. to me this is the perfect notepad++ replacement. surely i haven't tested everything as i do not need everything but for search and replace functions, there's probably nothing better. love it

description: From time to time it freezes. No good.
Pretty much every feature that I love Notepad++ for is missing. A simple text editor with limited features. For many users, that's enough.

OS: Kubuntu 22.04. I downloaded Notepadqq from Discover. This is Notepadqq v2.0.0-beta. It works better than Kate. Kate can’t handle big text files with no newline characters. You can’t search for words in the text. Each time, I had to open it with LibreOffice Writer since Kate was buggy so I finally looked for another TXT file opener. 
I opened a 4.18 MB file and I did a search. In this case, it is obviously very slow. It consumes too much CPU time. So, I’ll take off 1 star for that.
Has stupid bugs, opens many windows with the same content after restart, every time after restart freezes... Crazy stupid.
I was looking for this app long time ago very thank you guys ... you made my life good !
Freezes every other time i open it, stays at 100% CPU usage for no reason.

When reopening after shutdown it asks if you want to recover unsaved files. If you click "yes" it opens multiple windows with duplicates of the restored files; and every time you do this there are more and more windows, with dozens of duplicate copies of the same files.
I loved Notepad++ under Windows because it didn't prompt me whether to restore or not, it just reopened with all my work as I had left it, all in a single window. Notepadqq's behaviour in this regard is horrible, clogging up my workspace and making it a nightmare to organise my files.
summary: Opens a gazillion windows on restore

description: Perfect text editor for casual use or programming.

Show (enter) spesial sharacter and be able to replace it. 
It just work sloww. For replace an enter character in 50 000 lines takes forever, it freez every time. Finnaly install notepad++
Thanks and fix it
I'm sure I had this app on my Windows machine, called Notepad++. It's great to be able to open several files in tabs, some of which, I keep open for reference. Worth ten bob of any bugger's money!
This is the Linux version of the handy Windows program Notepad++. It's useful for opening several files at a time, taking random notes and programming.

I am a VSCodium enjoyer, however... For thinkpads of mine that cannot handle such IDEs, man, Notepadqq has been an amazing experience. SO many fantastic dark themes with coloful syntax too! Love it! So nostalgic and lightweight!
Think this is a great text editor, and reminds me of notepad++ which I love. I do hope the developer continues to work on this application, they are really on to something.
summary: Great little text editor - nearest thing notepad++ I can find

description: If you like Notepad++, you'll like Notepadqq
Better than Gedit.
best text editor.

I've always loved the app but had to remove due to obsolete KDE 5.11 runtime in the flatpak.

description: I am using this on my fedora 38 kde version...and its automatically closes in a few seconds.

description: As of Jan 2024 this project has been abandoned. The existing version has basic functionality, it can launch and open documents but there are many bugs. Code highlighting is not functional, code color themes are not respected when selected from the preferences dialog only showing black and white text, scrolling with the mouse scroll wheel does not work, etc.
does its job, a cool editor with cool features. Dont have a extentions section so im giving 4 stars but it is perfect.
Some update broke it, can't even scroll anymore, themes don't work

I use Notepad++ for html and css coding of web site and like the ability to switch back and fourth between both files being open to edit and create.
This program Notepadqq is a good second alternative in the event you need both the css and html open at the same time for following a stream of coding events.  One thing that would make this program better is a scroll bar on the right side of the gui interface.   Page Up and Page Down work along with arrow keys for moving through a page yet sometimes a scroll bar is more convenient.

If you like Notepadd++ yet do not like using WINE for some reason this program is a possible alternative.
summary: Good altenative for situations where you need two files opened
